screen_desc: This is a screenshot of a mobile device's app search screen. It displays recent search history, showing apps like LinkedIn, Zoom, Reddit, and Cash App. The search bar is located at the top, with options to type or use voice search. Each app is followed by an icon that allows users to open the app or clear the search history.
history_actions: click on the "Google Chrome" app located at the lower left.
click on the search icon (typically a magnifier) located at the top-right corner of the screen.
click on the search clear icon (indicated by an "X") located at the top right.

think_action.Thought: The user is on the app search screen, which shows recent search history. Since the user wants to uninstall Google Translate, I need to identify if Google Translate is already installed and locate it for uninstallation. However, Google Translate is not currently listed in the search results. The next step would be to either scroll through the app list or search for it manually.
Future Action Plan: Scroll through the app list to locate Google Translate or manually search for it if it is not present in the current search history.
Once found, locate the option to uninstall Google Translate.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Scroll down to see if Google Translate appears in the app list.
